title: Spatial vortex
data:

*For a list of all vortices, see [list of vortices](/List_of_vortices "List of vortices").*

| Flags                                                                                               | [Flying](/Flying "Flying") [Unbreathing](/Unbreathing "Unbreathing") [Confused](/Confused "Confused") [Insubstantial](/Insubstantial "Insubstantial") [Conjured](/Conjured "Conjured")                                                                                                      |

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| - | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A crazily shifting twist in the fabric of reality.***“It was just a colour out of space—a frightful messenger from unformed realms of infinity beyond all Nature as we know it; from realms whose mere existence stuns the brain and numbs us with the black extra-cosmic gulfs it throws open before our frenzied eyes.” -H.P. Lovecraft, “The Colour out of Space”. 1927. |

## Useful Info

**Spatial vortices** come into being in one of three ways: as a [Translocations](/Translocations "Translocations") [miscast effect](/Miscast_effect "Miscast effect"), through the actions of a [spatial maelstrom](/Spatial_maelstrom "Spatial maelstrom"), or as the result of [Xom](/Xom "Xom") wanting to have fun with you. In either case, spatial vortices are permanently confused, swirling storms of chaos, dealing heavy physical damage as well as [distortion](/Distortion "Distortion") effects each time they hit something.

## Tips & Tricks

If you have decent long-ranged attack capabilities, kill it from a distance, keeping 3+ tiles of space between you at all times. If you don't have such capabilities, just walk away.
html:
Spatial vortex

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.21: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

For a list of all vortices, see list of vortices.

spatial vortex v 
HP 35-72
HD 6
XP 165
Speed 15
AC 0
EV 5
Will Immune
Attack1 30 (hit: distort)


Resistances rF+
rC+
rElec
rPois+++
rDrown
rMiasma
rN+++
rTorm
rSticky
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Land
Intelligence Brainless
Uses Uses nothing
Holiness Non-living
Size Large
Type fire vortex, spatial vortex
Flags Flying
Unbreathing
Confused
Insubstantial
Conjured
A crazily shifting twist in the fabric of reality.

“It was just a colour out of space—a frightful messenger from unformed realms of infinity beyond all Nature as we know it; from realms whose mere existence stuns the brain and numbs us with the black extra-cosmic gulfs it throws open before our frenzied eyes.”
-H.P. Lovecraft, “The Colour out of Space”. 1927.

Useful Info

Spatial vortices come into being in one of three ways: as a Translocations miscast effect, through the actions of a spatial maelstrom, or as the result of Xom wanting to have fun with you. In either case, spatial vortices are permanently confused, swirling storms of chaos, dealing heavy physical damage as well as distortion effects each time they hit something.

Tips & Tricks

If you have decent long-ranged attack capabilities, kill it from a distance, keeping 3+ tiles of space between you at all times. If you don't have such capabilities, just walk away.
